intro: Unona fuscata, commonly known as the dark unona, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its dark green, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
